Package com.intellij.openapi.roots

Interface ModifiableRootModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ModuleRootModel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RootModelImpl

    public interface ModifiableRootModel
extends ModuleRootModel
    Model of roots that should be used by clients to modify module roots.

    Invoke commit() to persist changes, see also ModuleRootModificationUtil.

    See Also:
    ModuleRootManager.getModifiableModel(), ModuleRootModificationUtil

      • rearrangeOrderEntries

        void rearrangeOrderEntries(OrderEntry [] newOrder)

      • clear

        void clear()

      • commit

        void commit()
        Commits changes to a ModuleRootManager. Should be invoked in a write action. After commit(), the model becomes read-only.

        Use of ModuleRootModificationUtil.updateModel(Module, Consumer) is recommended.

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Must be invoked for uncommitted models that are no longer needed.

        Use of ModuleRootModificationUtil.updateModel(Module, Consumer) is recommended.

      • getModuleLibraryTable

        LibraryTable getModuleLibraryTable()
        Returns library table with module libraries.

        Note: returned library table does not support listeners. Also, one shouldn't invoke 'commit()' or 'dispose()' methods on it, it is automatically committed or disposed along with this ModifiableRootModel instance.

        Returns:
        library table to be modified

      • setSdk

        void setSdk(Sdk sdk)
        Sets SDK for this module to a specific value.

      • setInvalidSdk

        void setInvalidSdk(java.lang.String sdkName,
                   java.lang.String sdkType)
        Sets JDK name and type for this module. To be used when SDK with this name and type does not exist (e.g. when importing module configuration).
        Parameters:
        sdkName - SDK name
        sdkType - SDK type

      • inheritSdk

        void inheritSdk()
